intro: Chrysosplenium griffithii var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate golden spleenwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early summer, which are borne on short, erect stalks. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
